186012898.review:
Die erste Kampagne ist nen voller Witz und ansonsten ganz nett aber total unrealistisch vom Gameplay her.

Ist vom gameplay ein typisches 08/15 RTS mit realen Waffensystemen.
Soll nicht bedeuten das es schlecht ist hat aber null Anspruch an reale Taktiken,wer schnell klicken kann ist im Vorteil.

Sprich bei 2 Leuten auf den gleichen Level wird in den meisten Fällen der Gewinnen der schneller klicken kann und nicht der mit der besseren Taktik.

Taktiker und Strategen mit Anspruch an Reale Srategien sind hier falsch.

Ist aber wie gesagt absolut kein schlechtes Game wenn man so ein Gameplay mag aber hätte ich den vollen preis dafür bezahlt hätte ich mich wirklich geärgert für unter 10€ gehts aber in ordnung

185922947.review:
Don't bother with this game if you want single player modes. They're a buggy, janky, poorly made afterthought with lazy, cheating AI. 

The campaign map mechanics are especially a mess, full of random quirks that make no sense. For instance, if an enemy attacks into your big army, none of your ground units can move until you fight the battle, and then the battle magically depletes ALL initiative (move points) for ALL your units! So they can keep you from ever moving your army again by just suiciding something tiny at you every turn. 

And then the way zone control for battles changes is super buggy, the core logic itself is quite convoluted, there are a lot of reasons zone control can change from battle to battle. But even besides all those rules, sometimes it will just randomly change, you'll have just won a total victory and routed the enemy army, and then they attack again next turn and nonsensically you're knocked down to Alamo configuration (one zone versus all others) for no reason whatsoever. 

I could go on...moving your aircraft to a new airfield uses up all movement, when it should be as simple as "hey, just land here when you're done this turn 'k?" The "routing retreating armies" mechanic seems like it wasn't playtested, it can be really easily exploited if you have a helicopter squad, doing silly nonsensical things like sending that heli squad out over an enemy sector so it doesn't get its entire initiative zapped by a fight, then when the enemy army routs, send those helis at the retreating army, and voila, you just eradicated an entire enemy army with 4 helis.

The git gud edgelords will say any criticism is because you suck, but no, I'm beating the campaigns. It just feels cheesy, buggy, and undeserved when you're losing, until you figure out how to exploit the AI and janky game mechanics, and then it feels cheesy, buggy, and undeserved when you're winning.

185914755.review:
0/10
At a glance the game looks very promising and I am disappointed to have to leave this review, but this is just unforgivable. The game runs well and looks nice, the controls are customizable and work how you would expect. 
However this game has one very massive flaw.
Despite the game being Wargame: Red Dragon, the game features no dragons of any kind. While I can't say I was expecting fields of dragons of varying types, I would expect at LEAST one. This type of false advertising is a plague on the entire steam platform. The fact developers can get away with tricks like this is shameful.

185459658.review:
If you expect to have a game where you can use intelligent tactics to handle the enemy, don't play this game, or at least not the Horribly designed campaigns. Every guide you find will Lie to you, the AI is DUMB and just swarms their entire force at one point at a time, with the best stuff immediately, and the campaigns are designed so that you are ALWAYS the underdog and NEVER have what you need to possibly win. 

The AI will always use the same tactic over and over, mass you with the best units it has, whether that be tanks or helicopters, and it Actively is able to cheat and know where all your units are at all times, so even if your units are "hidden" it doesn't matter, the enemy will just use artillery to strike the location, even if they have no logical way of knowing where your stuff is, they just know.

Maybe the online is better, but I don't play online, I just play against AI, and this AI is absolutely shit, and the campaigns are designed to dick you over left and right.

184729032.review: Seems I'm coming back to this game every Christmas break, just to play the Korea war campaign. Compared with later games like Steel Division 2 and WARNO, you can bring in all the air power you have in range. Sometimes that can really help tip the balance of the battle, and for myself this campaign is the one that best captures the doctrine of superior air power in this series. This is why I return to this game, as well with the naval part that's also part of the campaign.

184587006.review: It's a good game but the community is toxic. These players are so racist they make Call of Duty players look like a bunch of sensitive liberals. The "Core gameplay" of this game is good. The problem is that it is so old that only super cracked veteran players are still playing, and the occasional noob, so multiplayer isn't fun becase everyone is going to be WAY better than you are. Or you're on the opposite side and paying against a noob who doesn't know how to play, which is also not as fun because it's too easy. It is terribly unbalanced. It makes frustrating weird gameplay decisions that don't make sense because it's trying to be "realistic" but it doesn't usually work out that way. Play their new game WARNO instead, it's a better game and you have a much better chance of winning.

183918339.review:
优点：剧情模式很有意思打几遍都不腻，画面质量还行，国家和单位很多，尤其是各个DLC国家个个身怀绝技。
缺点：对新手极其不友好。翻译做的一坨，有些完全可以翻译的单位名称根本不翻直接照搬，试了日语也是这个b样子。牢中做的一坨，疑似是制作组每天拿下班前的10分钟仓促赶工做出来的半成品，看着隔壁金姜棍的T-90和SU-25K馋哭了。DLC国家单位有特色确实很好，但数值疑似有些过于逆天了。喜欢我芬兰超人手拉M/39拉出64r/m的射速吗？

总之只能说类似俄罗斯原神，明知道有屎，但还是想吃。

如果你非要入坑，一定要玩蓝军。多人游戏老手基本都在蓝军。
红方命中率普遍在50%左右，日常先手开火先手miss，四发空四发然后暴毙都是日常，而且一堆特化单位，出错了就完蛋。游戏容错率低，社区友好度差，老玩家歧视新玩家非常普遍，不到元帅不配评价游戏，多V多玩家不配评论游戏，例如在贴吧吐槽红方命中率差，贴吧大佬告诉我红方是T0，是我们萌新不会玩，只玩多V多游戏没资格说话。对，我们萌新不会玩，现在我们都去玩更平衡的断箭去了。
